segments.name: AP Literature Students Pre-Essay
segments.pain_point: Can identify that Scout's narration is 'special' but can't articulate how the child/adult voice creates meaning or affects reader understanding
segments.why_this_is_hard: They sense there are two different perspectives operating but lack vocabulary and framework to explain how dramatic irony functions through narrative voice
search_terms: Scout narrator child vs adult TKAM
why does Harper Lee use Scout as narrator
Scout's voice important To Kill a Mockingbird

kernel_references.pattern: The Maturing Moral Witness pattern gives them precise language for the dual consciousness effect they intuitively feel
kernel_references.effect: They'll understand how retrospective narration creates layered meaning and can write sophisticated analysis of narrative technique

segments.name: High School Teachers Planning Deep Reading
segments.pain_point: Know students need to move beyond surface-level racism discussions to understand literary craft, but lack systematic approach to teaching narrative complexity
segments.why_this_is_hard: Thematic content often overshadows literary technique instruction; need structured way to show how form creates meaning
search_terms: how to teach point of view To Kill a Mockingbird

kernel_references.pattern: Provides scaffolded framework showing how retrospective narration systematically creates dual reader experience
kernel_references.effect: Can guide students through specific textual moments where child-innocence meets adult-understanding, making abstract concepts concrete

segments.name: Struggling Literature Students
segments.pain_point: Confused by what seems like inconsistency in Scout's voice - sometimes she sounds like a child, sometimes very mature - affects their basic comprehension
segments.why_this_is_hard: Without understanding narrator framework, the voice shifts feel random or like author mistakes rather than deliberate literary technique
search_terms: why does Scout talk like adult sometimes
Scout age voice To Kill a Mockingbird

kernel_references.pattern: The clear child-remembering vs adult-reflecting distinction resolves their confusion about 'inconsistent' voice
kernel_references.effect: Transform confusion into recognition of sophisticated narrative technique, improving both comprehension and confidence

segments.name: Self-Directed Adult Learners
segments.pain_point: Want to understand why TKAM feels different from other childhood-memory books but lack literary analysis framework to identify the specific techniques
segments.why_this_is_hard: Have reading experience but not formal training in narrative analysis; know the effect but can't name the cause

kernel_references.pattern: The dual consciousness concept explains the unique emotional resonance they felt but couldn't articulate
kernel_references.effect: Gain vocabulary and framework to understand their intuitive response, deepening appreciation for Lee's craft

segments.name: Graduate Students & Literature Teachers
segments.pain_point: Need fresh pedagogical approach to TKAM that moves beyond well-worn thematic analysis to reveal new layers of literary sophistication
segments.why_this_is_hard: TKAM analysis has become somewhat stale in academic settings; need innovative framework that reveals complexity without losing accessibility
search_terms: fresh perspective To Kill a Mockingbird

kernel_references.pattern: Pattern-first analysis offers systematic alternative to theme-first approaches, revealing structural sophistication
kernel_references.effect: Can demonstrate how formal elements create thematic meaning, providing rigorous yet accessible analytical framework
